Fields, dwellings, household members, heads, and limbs are all unfavorable; borrowing money is not excessive. Schemes and tasks should be completed swiftly. Childbirth is stable—pray for protection and good fortune. Trade brings swift profit; in households, the old are in danger, the young are safe. Entrusting others with tasks is auspicious; seeking office or promotion succeeds in winter. Resolving matters should be swift—delay brings difficulty. Lost items are hard to find.
The sun sets behind the western mountains,
Its color fading like dusk.
Counting the sorrows,
Schemes dissolve into vain sorrow.

**[Missing character] Forty-Fourth: Supreme Auspice – Harmonizing with Heaven**
Misfortune and fortune alternate by natural principle,
Aligning with the village’s resolve and Heaven’s will.
Disasters and decline are fated—now the ice melts,
Descending blessings and exorcising abundance strengthen the resolve.
Dark clouds veil the moon, dim and obscure,
The household’s affairs are unclear.
It is best to maintain the old for good fortune—
Wait until the clouds part, and all matters will flow smoothly.
Today’s divination holds this meaning:
Swift come, swift go—east or west.
Though wealth is not abundant,
Its clear light shines full before the eyes.

The Sage’s Intent declares: A person of integrity, whether poor or prosperous, remains constant. Unaffected by misfortune, how could lingering calamity remain? Conduct and retreat flow smoothly; blessings descend and exorcise. The virtuous are aided by Heaven, gaining fortune and prosperity. Disasters gradually recede; reputation spreads. All undertakings are auspicious—preserve peace forever. In matters of wealth, there is a third portion; storing goods is good, selling goods is good—all auspicious. Farming yields a good harvest. Illness in the old or young—wounds heal in seven or eight days; recovery is slow. Transactions succeed; travel is auspicious; the traveler has not yet arrived. Household and family are at peace; marriage should be swift—delay makes it difficult to complete. Buying fields, dwellings, household members, heads, or limbs should be swift—delay is difficult but beneficial. Documents are auspicious; schemes and tasks should be swift—delay requires effort. Seeking medical skills brings profit; seeking office or promotion should be swift. Childbirth is auspicious; lawsuits are auspicious.
Once clad in coarse cloth,
Today adorned in crimson.
Shedding the dust of the world,
Ancestral jade gleams with light.

**[Missing character] Forty-Fifth: Great Auspice – Yielding and Extending**
Wind arises from causes—how could it form in an instant?
How can divination seek good tidings?
Trade and commerce, no matter how far,
The obscured will rise first, the yielding will extend.
Wind and thunder stir, shaking heaven and earth,
All things sprout—from here, they grow.
The noble’s schemes all come to fruition,
The commoner’s household welcomes prosperity.

chunks.original_text: 此意占之得吉祥，於中求事见时亨。 虽然小辈来侵闹，大道身躯自吉昌。 圣意云：占亲利益，夙气寅缘。 经求谋望，财物绵绵。 公讼得理，病者迟痿，动为合吉，家宅安全，行人通泰，人月团圆。 占财，有五六分，置货吉，脱货吉。 迟种田吉，婚姻大利，出行利，行人迟，公讼吉，田宅、人口、头疋迟成。 脱事吉利，谋事成事不称意。 产孕吉利，求官升职名分不达。 借钱有三分，脱货后无价，动用吉。 欲识前途事，文书正好求。 忧危成吉兆，终日自然休。 □□　第四十六　中平　易脱有财 山川悠远历艰难，聚散须知反掌间。 近涉争知经久利，秋深冬首称心颜。 螣蛇入梦主忧疑，防慎家门有贼欺。 将来革故方为吉，进退如今未遇时。 求财於我事如何，守货占财守利多。 大放心怀长久去，自然瑛玉有人磨。 圣意云：经求涉远，贪心无厌。 财物聚散，少得十全。 秋冬有望，春夏休言。 一切谋运，事亦如然。 病者自痒，讼者留连。 若求安泰，宜谢苍天。 占财，买卖劳心置货好，秋冬吉，脱货快。 种田不完全，婚不吉。 出行秋吉利，行人至。 公讼难，借物秋冬吉。 病老少，春夏得，秋方瘥，多凶宜善事，秋冬病瘥迟。 买田宅、人口、头疋，秋冬吉，春夏凶。 谋事成事，秋冬吉，春夏不吉。 家宅人口，秋冬吉。 兴贩、文书、产孕，秋冬俱吉。 求官升职，秋冬吉。 托人用事难成，脱事上半年不利，下半年吉。 交易秋冬吉，余月不中。 禾粒方好去，用意望云梯。 谋望皆好用，云开月正辉。 □□　第四十七　大吉 素秉精诚格至神，行藏时获吉来临。 图谋若也瑜邪径，不误从前道合真。 密云无雨天边暗，却主忧疑亦不坊。 更慎小人来害己，家门暗昧事须防。 求财意欲一亨通，争奈才人西复东。 三五中间虽实有，事当并定一遭空。 圣意云：好善获吉，积恶就凶。 纵当正道，福不须求。 公讼泰定，占亲无忧。 所谋皆就，出路忧疑。 百事遂意，无有迟留。 占财，买卖正道无利，邪道大旺，置货好，脱货好。 种田大收，公讼不吉。 病老少，有阻犯土，并祈福保佑不妨。 婚姻吉利，诸事吉利。 出行吉，行人三日至。 见立未安坟，传书用破心，几回遭险浪，今日遇知音。 □□　第四十八　中平　阴阳 阴阳匹偶不徒然，勉强求神积善缘。 念念孰知遵大义，好於财物保安全。 宝剑新磨益见光，东西照耀倍寻常。 从前自有根基在，润色增明声播扬。 欲望平生富益和，怎知好事却多魔。 只宜守旧安居吉，自有凌云志气多。 圣意云：求谋大吉，缘法夙契。 若有机谋，事恐难济。 资财善保，公事莫易。 若占家宅，且须谨忌。 病者不妨，行者迟滞。 占财，买卖少有，置货好，脱货好。 求医业名分不成。 公讼不吉，破财不妨。 病者善愿无妨。 出行不中，行人未至。 失物后见，婚姻迟晚大吉。 种田薄收。 占事须防多阻滞，求名问卜事难量。 要卜守旧多安稳，自有荣华禄位昌。 聚四发成女，须忧事不中。 早园能备禄，家眷免灾凶。 □□　第四十九　上上　破星 石中有玉谁能别，沙裹藏金不易淘。 穷达在时须有得，何须怀抱只徒劳。 群鸦集噪可为奇，防慎阴人口舌危。 退步之时方可得，不然事绪主忧疑。 迟中求事可须迟，长久光阴事莫疑。

Here the divination yields good fortune—
in its midst, seeking affairs meets timely success.
Though petty men come to harass and clamor,
the great Dao’s body remains auspiciously flourishing.

The Sage’s intent declares:
Divining kinship brings profit, with long-standing qi and destined affinity.
In trade and scheming, wealth flows unceasingly.
Lawsuits prevail; the ill recover slowly.
All movement aligns with good fortune—
the household is secure, travelers prosper,
and family reunites in full moon’s glow.

Divining wealth: five or six parts favorable.
Purchasing goods is auspicious; selling goods is auspicious.
Planting late brings good harvest; marriage is greatly fortunate.
Travel is favorable; travelers return late.
Lawsuits are auspicious; fields, households, and livestock mature slowly.
Shedding burdens is fortunate; schemes and tasks fall short of desire.
Childbirth is auspicious; seeking office or promotion fails to advance.
Borrowing money yields three parts; after selling goods, prices fall.
All movement is auspicious.

To discern the road ahead,
petition with proper documents.
Worries and dangers turn to good omens—
throughout the day, all naturally resolves.

**[Missing character] Forty-Sixth: Moderate – Easy Release with Wealth**
Mountains and rivers stretch far, enduring hardships—
know that gathering and parting are but a turn of the hand.
Near ventures seem profitable, yet how can they last?
Deep autumn, early winter bring contentment.

A flying serpent in dreams portends doubt—
guard against thieves deceiving the household.
Only by shedding the old does fortune come;
advance and retreat now meet no timely hour.

Seeking wealth—how fare my affairs?
Holding goods, divining wealth, yields greater profit.
Release your cares and depart for long—
naturally, jade is polished by others.

The Sage’s intent declares:
Trade ventures far, greed knows no bounds.
Wealth gathers and scatters—
seldom is ten-tenths gained.
Hopes lie in autumn and winter;
spring and summer bring no words of promise.
All schemes and fortunes follow this pattern.
The ill recover slowly; lawsuits linger.
For peace and prosperity,
give thanks to Heaven.

Divining wealth: commerce wearies the mind, but purchasing goods is good.
Autumn and winter are auspicious; selling goods is swift.
Farming is incomplete; marriage is inauspicious.
Travel in autumn is favorable; travelers arrive.
Lawsuits are difficult; borrowing in autumn and winter is auspicious.
Illness afflicts young and old—
in spring and summer, recovery comes;
in autumn, healing is slow.
Much misfortune—good deeds are advised.
Illness in autumn and winter recovers late.
Buying fields, households, or livestock—
autumn and winter are auspicious; spring and summer, inauspicious.
Schemes and tasks—
autumn and winter are auspicious; spring and summer, not.
Households and family—
autumn and winter are auspicious.
Commerce, documents, childbirth—
all are auspicious in autumn and winter.
Seeking office or promotion—
autumn and winter are auspicious.
Relying on others for tasks is difficult;
shedding burdens is inauspicious in the first half of the year,
auspicious in the latter half.
Trade is auspicious in autumn and winter;
other months are unfavorable.

Grain ripens—now is the time to act,
with intent fixed on the cloud ladder.
All schemes and hopes are well-timed—
clouds part, the moon shines bright.

**[Missing character] Forty-Seventh: Great Auspice**
Innately holding pure sincerity, your conduct reaches the divine—
in due time, good fortune arrives.
If schemes stray from the straight path,
they will not err from the true Dao.

Dense clouds without rain darken the sky’s edge—
yet this portends doubt, not obstruction.
Beware of petty men harming you;
darkness veils the household—guard against affairs.

Seeking wealth, you desire unimpeded flow,
yet talent moves west, then east again.
Though three or five parts are substantial,
matters may yet end in one stroke of emptiness.

The Sage’s intent declares:
Good deeds bring fortune; evil accumulates misfortune.
Even when walking the right path,
blessings need not be sought.
Lawsuits settle peacefully; divining kin brings no worry.
All schemes succeed; journeys harbor doubt.
All affairs proceed as wished, without delay.

Divining wealth: upright commerce yields no profit;
devious paths flourish greatly.
Purchasing goods is good; selling goods is good.
Farming reaps great harvest; lawsuits are inauspicious.
Illness afflicts young and old—
obstacles from earth spirits require prayers for protection, but no harm.
Marriage is auspicious; all matters are fortunate.
Travel is auspicious; travelers arrive in three days.

Erecting a new grave unsettles—
sending letters strains the heart.
Several times you’ve faced perilous waves;
today, you meet a confidant.

**[Missing character] Forty-Eighth: Moderate – Yin and Yang**
Yin and yang pair not in vain—
strive to seek the divine, accumulating good affinity.
Moment by moment, who knows to follow great righteousness?
Better to safeguard wealth and ensure security.

A newly sharpened sword gleams brighter—
its east-west radiance surpasses the ordinary.
From the past, roots already exist;
polished and enhanced, its fame spreads.

Desiring lifelong wealth and harmony,
who knew good fortune would bring many demons?
Better to maintain the old—peaceful dwelling is auspicious.
Naturally, you possess soaring aspirations.

The Sage’s intent declares:
Seeking schemes brings great fortune, with destined affinity.
Yet if plotting, affairs may falter.
Preserve resources well; do not trifle with public matters.
Divining households requires caution.
The ill are unharmed; travelers are delayed.

Divining wealth: commerce yields little.
Purchasing goods is good; selling goods is good.
Seeking medical skills or official rank fails.
Lawsuits are inauspicious—losing wealth is no harm.
The ill recover through good vows.
Travel is unfavorable; travelers have not arrived.
Lost items will reappear; marriage is late but greatly auspicious.
Farming yields meager harvest.

Divining affairs: expect many obstacles.
Seeking rank or divination—outcomes are hard to measure.
To divine stability, maintaining the old brings peace—
naturally, glory and official position flourish.

Gathering four to form a woman—
beware, affairs may fail.
Early gardens secure provisions—
the household avoids disaster and misfortune.

**[Missing character] Forty-Ninth: Supreme – Breaking Star**
Who can distinguish jade within stone,
or pan for gold hidden in sand?
Prosperity and decline depend on timing—
why cling to empty aspirations?

A flock of crows gathers noisily—how strange!
Beware of slander from yin persons.
Only in retreat can you gain;
otherwise, affairs breed doubt.

Seeking matters in delay—delay is fitting.
Through long and enduring time, doubt not.

**[Missing character] Forty-Fifth: Great Auspice – Yielding and Extending**
Wind arises from causes—how could it form in an instant?
How can divination seek good tidings?
Trade and commerce, no matter how far,
The obscured will rise first, the yielding will extend.
Wind and thunder stir, shaking heaven and earth,
All things sprout—from here, they grow.
The noble’s schemes all come to fruition,
The commoner’s household welcomes prosperity.

Wealth and goods long held are hard to keep—

The Sage’s intent declares:
One who trusts in talent yet fails to reach their aim—
with steadfast resolve, what cannot be achieved?

The sick shall recover on their own;
disputes will not long linger.
Plans advance, fortunes rise—
seizing opportunity brings honor.
All affairs flow smoothly,
heroic spirit unbroken.

Divining wealth: trade delayed yields four or five parts.
Farming rewards labor with harvest.
Lost items soon appear;
marriages should be swiftly sealed—auspicious.
Vows for the ill bring recovery—
the young fare well, the old less so.
Selling goods delayed brings profit;
haste yields none.
Public disputes best settled in peace;
travelers soon return, the household thrives.
All matters prosper.

The household’s renown grows,
documents stand firm.
Desires are fulfilled—
yet casting lines in the sea brings alarm.

The divination of the Four Sage Perfected Lords concludes.
